importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news report indicates the timing of the announcement of Doug Martin's death, which is central to understanding the public reaction and context of the event.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline from 2012 to 2025 illustrates Doug Martin's NFL career span and the duration over which he made significant contributions to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at age 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He rushed for 1,454 yards and 11 touchdowns in his rookie season and earned a Pro Bowl berth.
Martin had 1,402 yards and six touchdowns in 2015, earning Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors.
He finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns in six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin also caught 148 passes for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
The Buccaneers issued a statement expressing deep sorrow over his passing and recognizing his lasting impact on the franchise.
Martin was named one of the top 50 players in franchise history during the team's 50-year anniversary celebration.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after a standout college career at Boise State, Martin became a key player with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over seven seasons. He earned Pro Bowl honors in his rookie season and again in 2015, and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015. He also caught 148 passes for 1,207 yards. The Buccaneers honored him as one of the top 50 players in franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration. The team and family expressed deep sorrow over his sudden passing, with the cause of death still unconfirmed.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
